issue.title: Bounces: The endpoint you have tried to access does not exist.

comment.body:
Hello @DePalmo 
This string `$mg = Mailgun::create(config('app.mailgun_api_key'), 'https://api.eu.mailgun.net');` does not look correct. Please, check correct domain. It must be your unique domain

issue.title: Improvement: SDK version headers v2 vs v3
issue.body:
Hi,

I got really confused at first that the User-Agent version is v2. Then found out it is hardcoded to `mailgun-sdk-php/v2 ...` while the major version now is v3 (3.6.)

https://github.com/mailgun/mailgun-php/blob/02d8b5c7e082a64fb8e9bf9aea557501bf69fa41/src/HttpClient/HttpClientConfigurator.php#L73

Composer has this nice helper that could be used to retrieve the installed version on the fly without a need to patch code every major update: 

```
\Composer\InstalledVersions::getVersion('mailgun/mailgun-php')
```
P.S. Might consider using some fallback value, in case someone runs code by direct download and includes it without Composer.

issue.title: Improvement: SDK version headers v2 vs v3
issue.body:
Hi,

I got really confused at first that the User-Agent version is v2. Then found out it is hardcoded to `mailgun-sdk-php/v2 ...` while the major version now is v3 (3.6.)

https://github.com/mailgun/mailgun-php/blob/02d8b5c7e082a64fb8e9bf9aea557501bf69fa41/src/HttpClient/HttpClientConfigurator.php#L73

Composer has this nice helper that could be used to retrieve the installed version on the fly without a need to patch code every major update: 

```
\Composer\InstalledVersions::getVersion('mailgun/mailgun-php')
```
P.S. Might consider using some fallback value, in case someone runs code by direct download and includes it without Composer.

comment.body: Thank you, we made those changes

issue.title: PHPDoc Type issue in Mailgun\Api\MailingList\Member
issue.body: The method `createMultiple` in ` Mailgun\Api\MailingList\Member` has the return PHPDoc type as `Mailgun\Model\MailingList\Member\UpdateResponse` but it actually returns `Mailgun\Model\MailingList\UpdateResponse` (due to the `Hydrator`)

comment.body:
> The method `createMultiple` in ` Mailgun\Api\MailingList\Member` has the return PHPDoc type as `Mailgun\Model\MailingList\Member\UpdateResponse` but it actually returns `Mailgun\Model\MailingList\UpdateResponse` (due to the `Hydrator`)

Sorry, maybe it's related to the [PR-801](https://github.com/mailgun/mailgun-php/pull/801)

issue.title: PHPDoc Type issue in Mailgun\Api\MailingList\Member

issue.title: Oudated symfony/http version
issue.body:
Hi there,

In my composer.json (Laravel project) I was using the http/symfony 6.3 version, although this gave an issue with making Http requests to the Mailgun client.

The following error occured: Undefined constant `CURL_SSLVERSION_TLSv1_2`

This project is using the http/symfony 5.3.0 version in the composer.json file. After changing it to the same version in the Laravel project it worked.

Is there a reason for this outdated http/symfony version?

Thanks!

comment.body:
> Hello Thank you, we will take a look into it and make an update

Let me know if there is anything you need testing or any more detail

comment.body: +1 on this. This package currently conflicts with Symfony `mercure bundle` being installed due to a conflict with `php-http/discovery <1.15` and `symfony/http-client`. Running 6.3 as above
